metadata.titel_preek: On Not Winning the Heisman Trophy

kernfrasen: lineman rises out of the debris
The Lord will fight for you

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: Yahweh is not unlike these football linemen... busy getting glory.

cognitieve_implicaties: God's actions are performative and public
Power is measured by the scale of the 'opponent' defeated
ethische_implicaties: Human success is measured by 'sacking' rivals
onbedoelde_consequenties: God as a narcissist seeking validation

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher re-activates the 'glory' concept by grounding it in the visceral, modern imagery of the NFL, moving it away from 'dead' liturgical language.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The sermon uses a 'clash of schemas' strategy. It establishes the Sports/Glory schema only to intentionally disrupt it with the Relational/Care schema, creating a dialectic tension that resolves in a redefined theology of glory.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: Narrative juxtaposition: The 'lineman' (God) leaves the 'field' (cosmic battle) for the 'bathroom/stands' (human need).

sterktes.beschrijving: Takes the abstract concept of 'Hesed' (grace/truth) and makes it concrete through the image of a father helping a toddler.
sterktes.voorbeeld: Full of what you can count on, if you are three years old or feeble.

risicos.beschrijving: The comparison of Yahweh to a lineman might anthropomorphize God to the point of losing transcendence.
risicos.voorbeeld: Yahweh is not unlike these football linemen.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may view God as a peer rather than the Holy Other.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A modern American football stadium during a high-stakes game.
sub_worlds: A domestic scene (toddler needing the bathroom)

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High; bridges modern experience with biblical scholarship.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Subverts the traditional 'King of Glory' Epiphany theme to focus on the 'Lowly Servant'.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in using a dominant secular source domain (Sports) to critique a theological target domain (Glory). It successfully moves from a 'Force' and 'Verticality' based understanding of God to one based on 'Connection' and 'Presence'.

revitalisatie_suggesties.huidige_status: Often a dead, shiny liturgical word.
revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Link it to the 'stench' and 'mundane' of the bathroom/feeble father.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: Glory is the smell of a diaper changed in the middle of a winning drive.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The transition from NFL to John's Prologue.
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Explicitly link the 'Only Son' to the 'Star Recruit' metaphor to maintain the sports schema longer.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Linemen are part of a team and have coaches/superiors.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Clarify that God's 'coach' is His own character/Hesed.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To show how God builds a 'home' for the vulnerable rather than just a 'stadium' for the strong.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A profound use of CMT to deconstruct triumphalism. The 'Heisman' metaphor is culturally resonant and theologically disruptive.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: Focuses on the cognitive mapping of 'success' rather than just the beauty of the football imagery.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Analyzes how the metaphor creates a mental 'world' rather than just identifying the learning style.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: Reveals that the preacher is using the 'MORAL STRENGTH IS PHYSICAL STRENGTH' metaphor to critique itself.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'J' vs 'P' source hypothesis as a metaphorical framework for two different ways of seeing God.
